title: The Rangji Temple
review: One of the ancient temple of Pushkar is devoted to Lord Rangji who is an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The temple has typical south indian architecture. Once you enter inside the premises you see the huge area and Giant gate. This temple has strong belief amongst the devotees. One should not miss it during the Pushkar Trip

title: Grand temple in the Village
review: You walk through the by lanes of Pushkar village through a lot of food stalls which display exotic international menus in Hebrew, French German etc.. There is something for everyone here. Cheap eats, Shopping et al

title: Very Big Temple.........Must Visit!!!!!!!
review: It is a very famous and big temple there. If you are visiting to Pushkar then you must visit it. It is very big from inside. I really liked it.

title: Giant temple in Pushkar
review: This is the must visit place in Pushkar. Its a huge temple of Lord Vishnu. Its very calm and peaceful place to visit.

title: Divine place
review: This temple dedicated to lord Venugopal is  beautiful and ancient. The temple is maintained very well and it is very clean. It is around 200 years old and the priests perform the rituals very sincerely. A must visit on a trip to Pushkar

title: Foreigners are not allowed inside
review: I went to visit this temple, which looked beautiful from the outside, but I was told that I was not allowed in because I am not Hindu. I was really disappointed, because I have been to many Hindu temples and went great lengths to get to Pushkar. I was welcomed at the dancing event outside, but not inside the temple. Many other foreigners were yelled at from a distance by a guard in front of everybody there being told also to not go in.. I am sure it is beautiful, but I will never know.

title: Nice and calm place
review: I visited this temple during camel fair 2018. It is a nice built temple and is very peaceful anf calm place. Must visit if you are in pushkar

title: Foreigners not allowed
review: Although this temple looks impressive from the outside, I was told by an official at the gate that foreigners were't allowed in.  However, there are many other temples in Pushkar and missing one won't spoil your enjoyment of this interesting town.

title: from outside nice
review: well big in the center not to pass, friendly stuff even the beggars disturb the situation, inside also joinable

title: Not an easy find
review: Had to go through a short inside type street which just lookes like more selling stotes to get to it although we did find another entrance off another regular street access.

title: too ancient beautiful temple
review: at pushkar 02 rang jee temple one is new and old both temple structure very good and management of old rang jee temple very caring for pilgrim.

title: nice scenic view, like south indian temples.
review: Good architecture closed in afternoon. You have get feel or large south indian temples from outside.

title: loved the temple
review: had a bad experience with a priest who insisted on giving me flowers and after reluctantly accepting them he tried to force me to go to the lake . He was so insistent i had to tell him to leave me alone ...he th

title: Only from outside
review: It seems to be a nice temple, as you can see, if you look only into the entrance portal and from outside in over the fence. Non-Hindus are not allowed inside. The temple is located very conveniently – in the main shopping street of Pushkar. It's somewhat unexpectedly to meet in Rajasthan obvious signs of south Indian sacred architecture. Although, of course, the height of gopuram can't compare with the temples of Trichy, Chidambaram and Madurai.

title: A must visit when in Pushkar
review: Its a beautifully crafted Rangnath mandir in Pushkar. It is just at the begining of the local market area.

title: South Indian style structure temple.
review: Old rang jee temple located in the main heart of city center south indian style architectures beautuful temple.

title: Nice from outside - foreigners not allowed
review: I believe that the practice of not allowing foreigners in the temple contradicts basic Hinduist values. It's nice to see from the outside - but thats not what primarily matters for a temple.

title: south indian style heritage structure
review: this temple devotee to lord vishnu and well managed by temple managment, structure south indian style.

title: Temple with South Indian Sculpture
review: Spacious and Well maintained Temple where you will get a feeling that you are in South India.  All the idols and Darshans are as per South Indian way and People who have not visited any South Indian temple must definitely visit this.  Even the priests are from South India

title: Vishnu temple...
review: An old Vishnu temple located in the heart of pushkar. This is built on South Indian architecture stlye and have been maintained well over the years

title: Old look
review: Its an old temple, very peaceful on the street next to the Pushkar lake. The temple building has an old rusty look, with unique carvings on the walls.

title: krishna temple
review: most visit this temple, its an ancient temple around 400 years old huge area, easy access and beautiful murti's

title: Timeless and sacred place
review: When visiting please respect and know that you can only enter the yard and see from outside.It is currently being renovated and certainly is a world heritage treasure.

title: South Indian  style temple in Pushkar
review: This temple has a tall 'gopuram' which is a hallmark of temples in South India. It is dedicated to Rangji, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. It is pretty popular with tourists.

title: Peaceful Quiet in the centre of town
review: This ancient temple, in Pushkar's town centre, is a quiet respite from the busy, motorcycle tooting streets. Just a few steps from the street, you can sit in the quiet surroundings.

title: Beautiful old temple
review: A wonderful old temple with many beautiful carvings with mythological stories from the churning of the oceans and more. Quiet and spiritual , a must to visit for a spiritual traveler but also for those who love history and architecture

title: Impressive temple, not accessible for foreigners
review: Its a very nice and impressive sightseeing attraction. However, it is not reachable for foreign tourists as entry is prohibited.

title: NIce, near to a beautiful market
review: Nice to see, but there is no more than what that picture shows, is near to a very beautiful market where we spent a lot of time watching the little shops, talking with the funny local people, nice experience

title: Beautiful idol
review: The temple is fairly rated but its really a nice temple on the Eastern side of the lake (go in the evening after 8pm). The idol is very beautiful and kept in the 3rd room inside which itself gives a very different view. Temple provides prasadam to the people here (3 tyms a day) which is a really good way of helping poors. Foreigners are not allowed.

title: DISCRIMINATION
review: Foreigners cannot enter. I was with a Induist Foreigner and he can not enter neither. BAD PLACE! They talk religion? Well this is not a good place.

title: Beautiful on the outside, but foreigners cannot visit
review: I attended a great concert during the Brahma festivities and the location made a beautiful setting. There are monkeys all over the place, and that is fun to watch.  The temple was being restored, which was really good because the place looks a bit run down, but someone told me those renovations are just cosmetic so in a few monts it will need more work.  Anyway, the external archiecture is nice

title: Heaven on Earth
review: I am speechless by the song of love in the atmosphere here. it inspires one to reach for the heights of love and to never come back again to  mundane existence.

title: Best Yoga Class Ever
review: I took a wonderful yoga class one evening in a rooftop room in a side building of the Old RangjiTemple and stayed for Satsang afterward.  I've studied yoga in the US since I was a kid, in all kinds of settings, and this was the most engaging experience spiritually-speaking than I ever remember having.  I am considering returning for the one month teacher training.

title: beautiful oasis
review: Just beautiful architecture and details, its located in a little inner square that connects with the main market street, so is really pacefull and quiet.

title: Nice temple with beautiful architecture.
review: It is a beautiful temple having amazing architecture and is surrounded by red sand which gets super hot in summers. But still a lovely place.

title: temple with golden pole
review: an another religeous temple in city of temples with a quite and devotee enviorment. music that played by musicains was awesome in temple

title: Still another temple worth going to
review: They just keep coming folks. Each town has these temples that just are always worth the effort of going to look at.

title: Unique mix of north and south architecture
review: This temple's architecture is a mix of Rajasthani and South Indian styles and thats what makes it special.Huge temple complex which has a temple museum also( though we could not visit it as it is nowdays getting renovated for the famous Pushkar mela).But quiet and nice place to visit situated right in the middle of the market lane (near Varah ghat).Its called Old Rangji temple, there is one new Rangji temple near the start of the market in Pushkar.

title: MUST VISIT
review: This temple is a must visit when you go to pushkar. Go there at the time of Aarti . It has a unique architechture and the pandits have a distinct way to give blessings to the visitors.

title: Typical South Indian temple
review: Foreigners are strictly not allowed inside this temple. Good artwork inside temple.. but not worth more than 15min..

title: Beautiful temple
review: This is a truly remarkable temple with some amazing patters on it, but it's a shame that foreigners aren't allowed inside the compound.

title: Simply superb temple
review: Holy environs of the temple and beautiful tall statues of Lord Venugopalan, Sri Rukmani and Sri Satyabama are worth the visit...unlike the New Rangji temple, he architecture of this temple is not south Indian inspired...but very much look like that of the Lord Brahma temple...must visit...all important and ancient temples are easily at walking distance from the Holy Pushkar lake...

title: very beautiful temple
review: The Old rang jee temple we visited the temple made in south indian style its a very beautiful and the location of the temple is very nice and very approachable to local market

title: Peaceful
review: The temple was right next to the Homestay that I was staying at. So close that I almost didn't notice it for the first few days. I visited this place during the evening Aarthi. There were very few people out there, which made the experience all the more pleasant. The temple looks like a south Indian temple and has the same architecture that you would see mostly in Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh. Foreigners are not allowed inside the main part of the temple although there were many who were taking photgraphs inside the compound of the temple. It was a very peaceful and calm expereince

title: Beautiful Temple
review: RangJi Temple is dedicated to lord vishnu and build in south indian style. The Temple 1823 by Seth Puran Mal Ganeriwal of Hyderabad. Its one good place to visit and prayer.

title: Nice temple
review: Nice calm temple in pushkar. worth a visit. Photography is not allowed inside the temple but you can click the outside view

title: A date with history of Pushkar and drama.
review: If you are visiting Pushkar, and do not know about this place, then you are likely to miss this place. The place has more of a historical significance. This is older than the Rangji Mandir (the other being on the main road), and this being little bit out of the way. There is history, why two temples, and there is drama about the kings and queens. The place is calm, clean and must visit. Be respectful, and do not take pictures once inside the temple. Let yourself immerse. If you allow, the walls tell the tales.

title: beautiful in its faded glory.
review: Gorgeous South Indian architecture. Lots of interesting details and faded painting. its beautifully lit at night

title: must visit old rangji temple
review: good old temple in pushkar and very important for hindu religious point of view must visit in pushkar ...

title: Beautiful old temple
review: Beautiful old temple with the lord as Venugopal and with Sri Rukmini and Satyabama. The temple has a beautiful tulsi plantation around the Parikrama, there is also a south facing Hanuman ji who is called as Balaji in Pushkar.

title: Pushkar, Holy City Is a reflection of Hindu puja and Rajasthan Culture
review: Good place to experience pujas, temples, dance and general shopping (clothing, jewelry, bags) as well as good food vegetarian food. Pushkar as a small desert city is also a respite from more chaotic Indian cities.

title: "very peacefull temple"
review: one of the most beautyful temple i have ever seen.the besy wat to learn about hindu religion &culture.

title: The Rangi Temple
review: Temple is very old and very auspicious. It sits surrounded by  buildings so I passed it up a few times before I found it. It has beautiful architecture.

title: A must visit in Pushkar
review: A very unique south indian temple in midst of Pushkar. Very clean & wonderful architecture to admire.

title: Worth a quick look
review: Near the main market, this temple is large and a little deserted. Go in for quick visit as you will pass in when you walk by (its near the main market road)

title: Worth a visit
review: A very interesting place midst Pushkar. Very clean & wonderful architecture to admire.

title: Worth a visit
review: I had the opportunity to come to this temple every day for 1 month. I took yoga classes at a yoga school inside this temple and this place is amazing, peaceful, people who work there very welcoming and of course beautiful architecture. Must visit in Pushkar!!!

title: Ancient temple.. inattentive & rude priests
review: The temple is beautiful, unfortunately it is managed by a set of priests who dont seem to care for the piety and sanctity of the temple. When we visited there was loud and idle chatter in front of the holy diety causing distraction to devotees. Such a glorious temple deserves to be managed better.

title: Peaceful
review: Beautiful architecture and very peaceful place to be. Unfortunately foreigners can't go inside the main temple, however it is still worth a visit to just absorb the energy of this Old temple

title: Its a beautiful temple
review: Come to this gorgeous temple,its calm and peaceful.Two days ago I was there and I was happy and in peace.Come with your families,its worthed

title: rang ji temple
review: mazedaar place as one of the famous temples rang ji ,old one gud one must see its located in the heart of pushkar and sprituality felt there,

title: Old and best structure
review: Temple is very old but really what a beauty, really its one of the best temple.

title: Rangji temple
review: Outstanding vaishnavite temple where every procedure is followed strictly in Vaishnavite sampradaya. Thanks to Bangur foundation and trust for maintaining this so well and to all the priests who strictly follow the sri vaishnava sampradaya for poojas

title: Nice temple
review: Very nice, quiet and clean. It's on the main road with not a lot of tourists and even less people that are trying to sell you something!

title: old is gold
review: its nice art temple  in pushkar . its  culture  art is very traditional work .    beautiful palace for visit .

title: The glimpse of the divineb
review: This beautiful temple keeps the name of being holy inspite of decades and the devotees come here for the glimpse of their lord . It is a must visit place if you are in Puskar .

title: Beautiful Temple
review: It beats me why they opened a new Rangji Temple when this beautiful temple was here. No shoes. It is well worth the visit.

title: Peace in middle of chaos
review: Beautiful building, quiet and deserted location. A good place to sit and relax, or just to pass by.

title: Worth a visit
review: Great temple and easy to find. Worth a visit to look around but also discover what's going on inside the grounds: music school, meditation and yoga classes, young boys playing cricket :)

title: Must Visit in Pushkar
review: Beautiful temple. It has the architecture similar to temples in the South. They also have yoga and music classes to offer there.

title: A beautiful place to visit
review: This is an active, south Indian temple. The architecture is beautiful. Anyone can stroll around the complex, but be sure to have your knees and shoulders covered. Non-Indians cannot go inside the central complex/temple where Lord Krishna resides. If you're lucky, he is paraded around town every day for one special week of the year - usually around March. It's a clean and quiet haven.

title: The Rangji Temple
review: One of the ancient temple of Pushkar is devoted to Lord Rangji who is an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The temple has typical south indian architecture. Once you enter inside the premises you see the huge area and Giant gate. This temple has strong belief amongst the devotees. One should not miss it during the Pushkar Trip

title: A Temple of Lord Vishnu
review: The temple is dedicated to Rangaji incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The temple is of South Indian architecture style and was built in 1823 by Sheth Puranmal. This is a huge temple having a Gopuram. There is also an image of Garuda in the temple. A leading temple of Pushkar. A nice visit.

title: Grand temple in the Village
review: You walk through the by lanes of Pushkar village through a lot of food stalls which display exotic international menus in Hebrew, French German etc.. There is something for everyone here. Cheap eats, Shopping et al

title: Very Big Temple.........Must Visit!!!!!!!
review: It is a very famous and big temple there. If you are visiting to Pushkar then you must visit it. It is very big from inside. I really liked it.

title: Giant temple in Pushkar
review: This is the must visit place in Pushkar. Its a huge temple of Lord Vishnu. Its very calm and peaceful place to visit.

title: Divine place
review: This temple dedicated to lord Venugopal is  beautiful and ancient. The temple is maintained very well and it is very clean. It is around 200 years old and the priests perform the rituals very sincerely. A must visit on a trip to Pushkar

title: Foreigners are not allowed inside
review: I went to visit this temple, which looked beautiful from the outside, but I was told that I was not allowed in because I am not Hindu. I was really disappointed, because I have been to many Hindu temples and went great lengths to get to Pushkar. I was welcomed at the dancing event outside, but not inside the temple. Many other foreigners were yelled at from a distance by a guard in front of everybody there being told also to not go in.. I am sure it is beautiful, but I will never know.

title: from outside nice
review: well big in the center not to pass, friendly stuff even the beggars disturb the situation, inside also joinable

title: Not an easy find
review: Had to go through a short inside type street which just lookes like more selling stotes to get to it although we did find another entrance off another regular street access.

title: Foreigners not allowed
review: Although this temple looks impressive from the outside, I was told by an official at the gate that foreigners were't allowed in.  However, there are many other temples in Pushkar and missing one won't spoil your enjoyment of this interesting town.
